Package jakarta.nosql.column

Interface ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder

  • Enclosing interface:
    ColumnDeleteQuery
    public static interface ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
    Besides the fluent-API with the select ColumnDeleteQuery.delete(), the API also has support for creating a ColumnDeleteQuery instance using a builder pattern. The goal is the same; however, it provides more possibilities, such as more complex queries.

    The goal is the same; however, it provides more possibilities, such as more complex queries. The ColumnQueryBuilder is not brighter than a fluent-API; it has the same validation in the creation method. It is a mutable and non-thread-safe class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ColumnDeleteQuery build()
      It will validate and then create a ColumnDeleteQuery instance.
      void delete​(ColumnFamilyManager manager)
      executes the ColumnFamilyManager.delete(ColumnDeleteQuery)
      ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder delete​(String column)
      Append a new column in to delete query.
      ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder delete​(String... columns)
      Append a new column in to delete query.
      ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder from​(String columnFamily)
      Define the column family in the query, this element is mandatory to build the ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
      ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder where​(ColumnCondition condition)
      Either add or replace the condition in the query.

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder delete​(String column)
        Append a new column in to delete query. It informs the fields to delete in the query instead of the whole record. This behavior might be different for each NoSQL database provider; therefore, it might be ignored for some implementations.
        Parameters:
        column - a column field to delete query
        Returns:
        the ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when the document is null

      • delete

        ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder delete​(String... columns)
        Append a new column in to delete query. This first step will inform the fields to delete in the query instead of the whole record. This behavior might be different for each NoSQL database provider; therefore, it might be ignored for some implementations.
        Parameters:
        columns - The columns fields to delete query
        Returns:
        the ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when there is a null element

      • from

        ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder from​(String columnFamily)
        Define the column family in the query, this element is mandatory to build the ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
        Parameters:
        columnFamily - the column family to query
        Returns:
        the ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when columnFamily is null

      • where

        ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder where​(ColumnCondition condition)
        Either add or replace the condition in the query. It has a different behavior than the previous method because it won't append it. Therefore, it will create when it is the first time or replace when it was executed once.
        Parameters:
        condition - the ColumnCondition in the query
        Returns:
        the ColumnDeleteQuery.ColumnDeleteQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when condition is null

      • build

        ColumnDeleteQuery build()
        It will validate and then create a ColumnDeleteQuery instance.
        Returns:
        ColumnDeleteQuery
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - It returns a state exception when an element is not valid or not fill-up, such as the from(String) method was not called.

      • delete

        void delete​(ColumnFamilyManager manager)
        executes the ColumnFamilyManager.delete(ColumnDeleteQuery)
        Parameters:
        manager - the entity manager
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when manager is null
        IllegalStateException - It returns a state exception when an element is not valid or not fill-up, such as the from(String) method was not called.
